messages.content: How do I store tabular data in Javascript?

There are several ways to store tabular data in JavaScript. One common approach is to use a ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) tool like Sequelize or MongoDB ORM to map the tabular data to a database table and store it in the browser. Another option is to use a data mapping library like  backbone.js, which allows you to define your data structure in a way that makes it easy to work with in the browser. Another way is to use a JSON object, which can be easily stored and retrieved in JavaScript.
I want the table to contain 3 columns (or equivalent): file name, score, and number of matches. This is for preference ranking of files. Which of those options would be best?

One option would be to use a ORM like Sequelize or MongoDB ORM to map the tabular data to a database table with columns for file name, score, and number of matches. This would allow you to easily store and retrieve the data, as well as perform any necessary queries. Another option would be to use a data mapping library like backbone.js, which allows you to define your data structure in a way that makes it easy to work with in the browser. Both options will give you a way to store and retrieve the data in JavaScript.
